subtitle: M. Catonis lib. I, M. Terentii Varronis lib. III, L. Iunii Moderati Columellae lib. XII, eiusdem De arboribus liber separatus ab alijs, quare autem id factum fuerit, ostenditur in epistola ad lectorem, Palladii lib. XIIII, de duobus dierum generibus simulq[ue] de umbris & horis, quae apud Palladium in alia epistola ad lectorem, Georgij Alexandrini enarrationes priscarum dictionum, quae in his libris Catonis, Varronis, Columellae.
contributions: Pforzheimer Bruce Rogers Collection (Library of Congress)
title: Libri de re rustica
subjects: Agriculture, Ancient -- Rome -- Early works to 1800
Latin prose literature, Medieval and modern
publishers: In aedibus Aldi, et Andreae soceri

notes.value:
LC copy formerly owned by Bruce Rogers; with bookplate of Charles Jacob Stuart.
Adams S-805
The collection was first printed in 1472 and repeatedly thereafter; known by its conventional title "Scriptores rei rusticae."
Edited by Giovanni Giocondo.
Imprint from colophon.
Signatures: *⁸ 2a-2b⁸ 2c¹⁰ a-h⁸ i⁴ k-z⁸, A-Q⁸. 2c10 blank.
